text: Flowing brooks and fords can be dangerous for the unprepared.\\nInfantry will have trouble crossing, while cavalry are less likely to get bogged down.
Roads allow all units to move quicker.
Scorched and blistered, there is nothing left but ash.\\nAny previous terrain features have been removed.
Uneven, needle-like terrain impedes both foot and hoof alike.\\nHeavy units are especially impaired.
Dense undergrowth hides many threats.\\nWill conceal all units.
Scrub provides cover for light infantry units.
The Water at this position is too deep for units to traverse its murky depths.
Deep snowdrifts hinder progress for any traveller.\\nLight units will find it especially difficult to fight in these conditions.
Coarse, rough and irritating, sand gets everywhere, creating inhospitable conditions.\\nUnits suffer movement penalties from the heat while moving through it.
